ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Player Visited Cargo Bay Early
ResponseRule.description: Player managed to get down to the Cargo Bay before Deep Storage, but they are on the other side of the sealed Cargo Bay. Sarah calls player, says there's no way through.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Player Visited Cargo Bay Early, Reminder
ResponseRule.description: Player Comes to Cargo Bay Interior Door 2nd Time, Basically a reminder that "You Can't Get In This Way" if the player tries again (say, after not playing the game for a few days).

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, ShuttleSecrets
ResponseRule.description: Matt works on the bridge and closely observes station operations then secretly reports to Sarah that some shuttle dockings are being concealed. Matt and Sarah are putting thier careers, and perhaps lives, on the line by investigating this, but Sarah's insitnct tells her something fishy has been going on and that the people on top can't be trusted. This Transcribe is found on the bridge in Cothron's workstation. They are basically uncovering the secret volunteer unloading into psychotronics.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, EVA
ResponseRule.description: Morgan has been ejected into space and adrift outside Talos. Sarah detects him on ther security station and radios him to travel to Cargo Bay. She knows all conventional airlocks are sealed, but the cargo loading system provides a way in and out of Talos.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, FoundTurretPlan
ResponseRule.description: Sarah tasked Morgan with making turrets to help defend her and her men from aliens. He has recovered a crucial component of that, the blueprint needed to manufacture them. She is pleased with this progress.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, APEX Predator I
ResponseRule.description: Morgan has activated the self destruct and Talos is now on a countdown to blow up. Sarah is safely aboard the last remaining shuttle ready to flee the station. She wan't to wait for Morgan to get there and leave with them, but time is running out.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Apex Predator II
ResponseRule.description: Morgan has activated the self destruct and Talos is now on a countdown to blow up. Sarah is safely aboard the last remaining shuttle ready to flee the station. She wan't to wait for Morgan to get there and leave with them, but time is running out.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Sarah Alex Argue
ResponseRule.description: Recorded convo of Sarah asking for advanced weapons and CEO Alex saying they don't need them. This is on Sarah's transcribe. She has been holding onto it to cover her ass. This hints at a long-running conflict between these two.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Big Door Code
ResponseRule.description: Recording On Sarah's TS. Aliens have been locked out of Cargo Bay and Sarah records the code to open that door here. She wants to keep it secret because opening that door will allow aliens to flood the compartment and kill them all. (So if she dies Morgan can get it)

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Commendations
ResponseRule.description: Sarah tells Kevin Brooks that he is getting a bonus. The idea is to support fiction that very wealthy, famous and influential people sometimes visit Talos. Brooks did a great job staying professional while tending to some epic-level celebrities.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, LogEntry
ResponseRule.description: Sarah and her agents tried to help crewmembers get to the escape pods and get off Talos, but the escape pods did not function and then aliens set in on them and a chaotic slaughter was on. The security officers did not panic and fell back to the Cargo Bay where they could set up a defensive position. Most of the civilian crew was lost. Describes the heart-wrenching order to seal the Cargo bay, even as survivors were screaming for help, because the aliens had arrived. Commendations are in order for officers Hayashi, Hertz, Brooks, Cool, and Rose. Posthumous honors for Officers Teague and Remmer.

ResponseRule.name: Matt Cothron - Reports on Mysterious Shuttle Activity
Sarah: TS, PowerOn
ResponseRule.description: Sarah tells Morgan "good work" when the power to the Fabricator comes on. She has tasked him with fabricating turrets for the defense of herarea and this is one of the major steps.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Suffocating I
ResponseRule.description: Sarah calls Morgan and says they have been barricaded into Cargo Bay and the hired sabotuer Dahl has shut off the oxygen supply. There has been damage to the area and breathable air will run out fast.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Suffocating II
ResponseRule.description: Sarah calls Morgan and says they have been barricaded into Cargo Bay and the hired sabotuer Dahl has shut off the oxygen supply. There has been damage to the area and breathable air will run out fast.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, BreatheAgain
ResponseRule.description: Commander Dahl tried to force Morgan to do his bidding by threatening Sarah and her security officers holed up in Cargo Bay. He remotely cut off thier air supply and barricaded them inside. The air has just started flowing again and Sarah calls Morgan to say they can breathe again

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Headed to Life Support
ResponseRule.description: Player killed Kaspar which allows Sara and any survivors to get out of the Cargo Bay. Sarah calls to let the player know she's headed to Life Support.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Headed to Life Support-Alone
ResponseRule.description: Player killed Kaspar which allows Sara and any survivors to get out of the Cargo Bay. Sarah calls to let the player know she's headed to Life Support. She's alone.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: Life Support Captured, Sarah Alone
ResponseRule.description: Chief Sara Elazar attacked life support to re-capture it from Dahl's operators. She succeeded, but some lives were lost.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: Life Support Captured
ResponseRule.description: Chief Sara Elazar attacked life support to re-capture it from Dahl's operators. She was alone.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, ElevatorMassacre
ResponseRule.description: Sarah talks to one of her agents, Erica Teague, as she leads a group of survivors to the elevator after discovering that the escape pods will not operate. They are going to try and reach the shuttle bay to await rescue, only to discover that the elevator off this deck is not operating. They are at a dead end with something following them. Erica was supposed to be safe in Cargo bay but chose to rush out and try to help people escape at the last instant.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Reboot: Was That You?
ResponseRule.description: Power on Talos was just rebooted causing all the systems on the station to shut down for a brief period. For a moment Sarah and her survivors were without lights, heat, gravity, radiation shielding or air circulation. Like spending a moment in a metal coffin adrift in space.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Find Grant Lockwood
ResponseRule.description: Sarah calls one of her officers and tells them to find a crewman that has gone AWOL and is a risk to smooth operation of the space station. The alien crisis has not revealed itself yet so this is not life-or-death, although the stakes are meaningful.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Come to the Shuttle Bay I
ResponseRule.description: Morgan has activated the self destruct and Talos is now on a countdown to blow up. Sarah is safely aboard the last remaining shuttle ready to flee the station. She wan't to wait for Morgan to get there and leave with them, but time is running out.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Come to the Shuttle Bay II
ResponseRule.description: Morgan has activated the self destruct and Talos is now on a countdown to blow up. Sarah is safely aboard the last remaining shuttle ready to flee the station. She wan't to wait for Morgan to get there and leave with them, but time is running out.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Final Goodbye, Morgan Staying. Yes Turrets.
ResponseRule.description: Sarah's final goodbye as the shuttle she is on leaves Talos without Morgan. As far as she knows Morgan has zero chance of survival. She may hold Morgan partially responsible for the disaster that killed so many people and will not be overly sentimental, but Morgan did help her by providing support when he arrived in her refuge. She senses that Morgan may be sacrificing him/herself as atonement.

ResponseRule.name: Sarah: TS, Final Goodbye, Morgan Staying. No Turrets
ResponseRule.description: Sarah's final goodbye as the shuttle she is on leaves Talos without Morgan. As far as she knows Morgan has zero chance of survival. She may hold Morgan partially responsible for the disaster that killed so many people and will not be overly sentimental. Since he did not manage to help her when she was in need she feels justice is being served.
